us.phonetic: /ju; unstressed jʊ, jə/, (yo̅o̅; unstressed yŏŏ, yə)

dsense.name: you
dsense.guideword: (second person singular: subject) (第二人称单数，主格)

example.eg: You should eat your green beans.
example.egtrans: 你应该把青豆吃了。

dsense.name: you
dsense.guideword: (second person plural: subject) (第二人称复数，主格)

example.eg: Children, you should eat your green beans.
example.egtrans: 孩子们，你们应该把青豆吃了。

dsense.name: you
dsense.guideword: (second person singular: direct object) (第二人称单数，直接宾语)

example.eg: I love you.
example.egtrans: 我爱你。

dsense.name: you
dsense.guideword: (second person plural: direct object) (第二人称复数，宾格)

example.eg: I can see you.
example.egtrans: 当老师跟你们说话时，你们所有人应保持安静。

dsense.name: you
dsense.guideword: (second person singular: indirect object) (间接宾语，第二人称单数)

example.eg: I'm giving this to you, because I think you will use it more than I will.
example.egtrans: 这东西你比我能用得上，给你吧。

dsense.name: you
dsense.guideword: (second person plural: indirect object) (间接宾语，第二人称复数)

example.eg: When the teacher is talking to you, you should all be quiet.
example.egtrans: 老师说话的时候你们要安静。

dsense.name: you
dsense.guideword: (second person singular: after preposition) (介词后，第二人称单数)

example.eg: Wait for me to put my coat on, and I'll come with you.
example.egtrans: 等下，我穿上大衣就跟你走。

dsense.name: you
dsense.guideword: (second person plural: after preposition) (介词后，第二人称复数)

example.eg: Guys, can I come to the party with you?
example.egtrans: 伙计们，我能跟你们一起去参加派对吗？

us.phonetic: /ju; unstressed jʊ, jə/, (yo̅o̅; unstressed yŏŏ, yə)

example.eg: You should never swim after eating.
example.egtrans: 不管是谁，刚吃完后都不应该游泳。

example.eg: You should never swim after eating.
example.egtrans: 饭后一定不要游泳。

dsense.name: you
dsense.guideword: (emphatic address to more than one person) (强调性称呼多个人)

example.eg: You boys can't run very fast, can you?
example.egtrans: 你们男孩子跑不快，是不是？

dsense.name: you
dsense.guideword: (direct address to one person) (指称特定的某个人)

example.eg: You, Mister Rogers, come over here right now!
example.egtrans: 你，罗杰斯先生，现在立马给我过来！

dsense.name: you
dsense.guideword: colloquial (singular: before gerund) (动名词前，单数)

dsense.name: you
dsense.guideword: colloquial (plural: before gerund) (动名词前，复数)

example.eg: I dislike you interrupting when I am speaking.
example.egtrans: 我不喜欢说话时被你打断。

us.phonetic: /ju; unstressed jʊ, jə/, (yo̅o̅; unstressed yŏŏ, yə)

example.eg: When something bad happens, all you can do is make the best of it.
All you can do is whine; you never fix your problems.
At the all-you-can-eat restaurant he stuffed himself with cheap food.

dsense.name: and what have you
dsense.guideword: informal (and the like, and similar) (非正式用语)

trans_examp.trans_cn: 你有兴趣吗？, 你也来吗？
准备点餐了吗？，可以点菜了吗？

example.eg: Muddle through as best you can, and we'll fix the mistakes later.
Come and visit me as often as you like.
Feel free to stop by my office as often as you wish.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 愿意多少次就多少次, 随时都可以

example.eg: As you know, the building will be demolished on Saturday.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 正如你所知, 你知道的

dsense.name: as you like, as ... as you like

trans_examp.trans_cn: 随你喜欢, 只要你喜欢

example.eg: You've finished your work. Now you're free to do as you please.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 你喜欢怎样就怎样, 按照你的意愿

example.eg: As you say, that spaghetti is delicious!

dsense.name: as you will
dsense.guideword: archaic (expressing obedience: as you wish) (古语)

example.eg: You may do as you will, but that does not mean your actions will be right.
We will be sure to arrange everything as you wish.

dsense.name: away with you
dsense.guideword: slang, regional (Leave, get going, be on your way) (俚语，方言)

example.eg: Away with you! proclaimed the king.

dsense.name: Be careful what you wish for.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 要慎重许愿。，别轻易许愿。

example.eg: Christmas will be here before you know it.

dsense.name: better you than me (US), rather you than me (UK)
dsense.guideword: (I would not like to be in your position)

trans_examp.trans_cn: 幸亏是你而不是我, 还好是你不是我

dsense.name: between you and me, between ourselves

example.eg: Between you and me, I think Stella has fallen in love with him.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 你知我知, 不要告诉别人

dsense.name: bite off more than you can chew
dsense.guideword: figurative, informal (accept an overly ambitious task)

example.eg: Gabriella thought she would enjoy being team leader, but she may have bitten off more than she can chew.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 贪多嚼不烂, 不自量力

example.eg: "Bless you!" said Suzie when I sneezed.
example.egtrans: 我打喷嚏时，苏茜对我说：“上帝保佑你！”

example.eg: Bless you for helping us in our hour of need.
example.egtrans: 感谢您在我们需要的时候帮助我们。

example.eg: I want to talk to both of you after class.
Can I help you? asked the sales clerk.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 有什么可以帮您的吗？, 需要帮忙吗？

dsense.name: Catch you later, Catch you later!

example.eg: What should I wear to the party? Just come as you are.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 随便穿就好, 穿平时的衣服
作茧自缚, 自食其果
追悔莫及, 后悔莫及

dsense.name: Could you please...?
dsense.guideword: (polite request) (请某人做某事的礼貌用语)

example.eg: Could you please tell me where the bathroom is?

trans_examp.trans_cn: 你可以…吗？可不可以麻烦你…？请你…，可以吗？

dsense.name: have your work cut out for you
dsense.guideword: informal, figurative (have a hard task ahead)

example.eg: The house Joe and Maggie have bought needs a lot of renovation; they certainly have their work cut out for them.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 面临挑战，面对困难, 面临艰巨的任务

example.eg: D'you think you could help me?

dsense.name: damned if you do, damned if you do and damned if you don't

example.eg: I did all I could to catch the train, but it was too late.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 尽你所能, 尽力而为

example.eg: After you've finished that task you may do as you please.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 随意, 随便, 随便

example.eg: I'm sure the police will catch the burglar; they're doing everything they can.

dsense.name: do everything you can to do [sth]

example.eg: Choosing a university is an important decision, so make sure you do everything you can to get it right.
example.egtrans: 上哪所大学是一个重要的选择，所以一定要确保竭尽全力，做出正确的选择。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 尽一切努力做某事, 竭尽全力做某事

example.eg: Just do the best you can.  That's all anybody could ask for.
Since you've finished your work, do what you like for the rest of the day.

trans_examp.trans_cn: （你）想怎样就怎样, 别客气

dsense.name: do with what you've got, make do with what you've got

trans_examp.trans_cn: 利用你现有的资源做某事

dsense.name: Do you copy?, Do you copy me?

example.eg: Don't you dare speak to me like that, young man!
Why am I asking you for directions? - well, you live here, don't you?
He might be married with three kids, for all you know.

dsense.name: F*** you!
dsense.guideword: vulgar, offensive, slang (expressing anger or contempt)

example.eg: If you think I'm going to work for you for nothing ... well, f*** you!
Brett really said that? Get along with you!
example.egtrans: 布雷特真的这么说了？真不敢相信！

example.eg: If you follow the rules and obey all guidelines, you will get what you deserve.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 得到相应回报, 善有善报

example.eg: If you deliberately break the rules and disregard authority, you will get what you deserve.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 恶有恶报, 活该, 得了报应

example.eg: God bless you and keep you safe, my child.
"Good day to you!" shouted Jenkins from across the street.
example.egtrans: “日安！”詹金斯从街道对面喊道。

example.eg: You have lost 10 pounds already? Good for you!

trans_examp.trans_cn: 做得不错, 干得漂亮

example.eg: Eating plenty of fruits and vegetables is good for you.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 有益你的健康的, 对你的（身体）有好处的

dsense.name: Have at you!
dsense.guideword: dated (prepare to be attacked) (过时用语)

dsense.name: have it coming, have it coming to you

example.eg: When Gina was expelled from school, everyone said she'd had it coming.
"I broke a nail but I don't have an emery board." "Here you are - use mine."
example.egtrans: “我的指甲断了，但我没有指甲砂锉。”“拿去，用我的吧。”

dsense.name: here you go
dsense.guideword: informal (this is what you need) (非正式用语)

example.eg: Was it you who ordered the steak, sir?  Here you go.
Cheers, here's to you!
Hey, you! Stop doing that.
"How are you doing?" "Not too bad, how about you?"

trans_examp.trans_cn: 最近怎么样？, 在忙什么呢

example.eg: Hello Phil, how are you? Good to see you again.
example.egtrans: 菲尔，你好吗？很高兴再次见到你。

example.eg: Store clerks often ask customers, "How can I help you?"

trans_examp.trans_cn: 我能为您做什么吗？，您需要什么？

example.eg: How dare you say I can't cook!  So, you told her she was a fat cow?? How dare you!!

dsense.name: How do you do?
dsense.guideword: formal (Pleased to meet you.) (招呼语，正式)

example.eg: How do you do? I'm delighted to meet you.
Well that was certainly a fine how-do-you-do wasn't it?
This is not love! I hate you!
example.egtrans: 那才不是爱！我恨你！

example.eg: I like you. You seem like such a nice person.

dsense.name: I look forward to hearing from you
dsense.guideword: written, slightly formal (application, request: signing off) (申请、请求：落款，书面)

example.eg: Thank you for your attention, and I look forward to hearing from you soon.

dsense.name: I love you
dsense.guideword: (declaration of strong affection) (表达强烈的感情)

example.eg: I love you, Mom!
example.egtrans: 妈妈，我爱你！

dsense.name: I love you
dsense.guideword: (declaration of strong romantic feelings) (表达浪漫的爱情)

example.eg: I love you and I want to spend the rest of my life with you.
example.egtrans: 我爱你，想和你共度余生。

example.eg: I love you so much that I can't stand to be apart from you.
example.egtrans: 我如此爱你，所以我不能忍受与你分开。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 我如此爱你, 我深爱着你

example.eg: I miss you, my darling. Come home soon.
example.egtrans: 亲爱的，我想你。快点回家吧。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 我想你, 我想念你, 我思念你

example.eg: John, I don't just love you, I need you!
example.egtrans: 约翰，我不只是爱你，我还很依赖你！

trans_examp.trans_cn: 我需要你, 我依赖你

dsense.name: I want you
dsense.guideword: informal (I am sexually attracted to you) (非正式用语，有性暗示)

example.eg: I want you. Let's leave this party and go back to my place.

dsense.name: I will miss you, I'll miss you

example.eg: Goodbye, son. I'll miss you.
example.egtrans: 再见，儿子。我会想你的。

example.eg: I worship you and the ground you walk on!

dsense.name: I'll be seeing you, I'll be seeing you!, Be seeing you!

example.eg: Your meal looks disgusting; if I were you, I'd complain.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 如果我是你的话, 如果是我的话

example.eg: And then, if you please, he actually asked me if I had any grandchildren! I'm only 32!
Come this way, if you please.  Take a seat, if you please.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 请, 如果你愿意，如果你不介意

dsense.name: if you say so
dsense.guideword: (I disagree but do not want to argue) (表示说话人不赞同)

dsense.name: if you say so
dsense.guideword: (I tentatively agree) (表示说话人赞同但稍有迟疑)

example.eg: I can lend you some money if you want.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 如你所愿, 如果你想的话

example.eg: We can always postpone the meet-up for another time, if you wish - it's up to you.
We can get Mexican or Chinese food tonight - it's up to you.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 由你来定, 你说了算

example.eg: The novel is a murder mystery that will keep you guessing until the very end.

dsense.name: keep your wits about you, have your wits about you

example.eg: No one has ever explored this part of the forest and we don't know what we'll find, so keep your wits about you.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 保持警惕, 多加小心, 三思而后行

example.eg: Mark my words! That boy will always be a troublemaker.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 你运气还真不错呢！, 记住我的话
